poem.title: Health and Safety at Work
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Jute's not for threading needles; Lances, maybe, in jousts: Two bobbins like a fireman's hose (no knots or kinking) Where one knight jouks and diddles death In that quilted dobbin-to-dobbin situation. What the deuce! A king can make a belted knight, But can he make him stick to apple juice? They really should affix elastic ropes Plus airbags fit to mitigate An epidemic of defective bungees.
